required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reduced-Dose Intensity-Modulated Radiation Therapy With or Without Cisplatin in Treating Patients With Advanced Oropharyngeal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Phase II Trial for Patients With p16 Positive, Non-Smoking Associated, Locoregionally Advanced Oropharyngeal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This randomized phase II trial studies the side effects and how well modestly reduced-dose intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT) with or without cisplatin works in treating patients with oropharyngeal cancer that has spread to other places in the body (advanced). Radiation therapy uses high energy x rays to kill tumor cells. Drugs used in chemotherapy, such as cisplatin, work in different ways to stop the growth of tumor cells, either by killing the cells, by stopping them from dividing, or by stopping them from spreading. It is not yet known whether IMRT is more effective with or without cisplatin in treating patients with oropharyngeal cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVES:
-To select the arm(s) achieving a 2-year progression-free survival rate of >= 85% without unacceptable swallowing toxicity at 1 year.
SECONDARY OBJECTIVES:
- To determine patterns of failure (locoregional relapse versus distant) and survival -(overall and progression-free) at 6 months and 2 years.
- To determine acute toxicity profiles at the end of radiation therapy and at 1 and 6 months.
- To determine late toxicity profiles at 1 and 2 years.
- To determine patient-reported swallowing outcomes at 6 months and 1 and 2 years.
- To determine the predictive value of 12-14 week, post-treatment fludeoxyglucose F 18 (FDG)-positron emission tomography (PET)/computed tomography (CT) for locoregional control and progression free survival (PFS) at 2 years.
- To determine the predictive value of blood and tissue biomarkers for disease outcomes at 2 years.
- To determine swallowing recovery per videofluoroscopy imaging at 2 years.
After completion of study treatment, patients are followed at 1 and 3 months then every 3 months for 2 years, every 6 months for 3 years, and then annually thereafter.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Alive Without Progression at Two Years (Progression-free Survival)
primary_outcome.description: Progression is defined as local, regional, or distant disease progression or death due to any cause. Percentage is estimated using the binomial distribution.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Local-regional Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Local-regional failure is defined as local or regional progression, salvage surgery of the primary tumor with tumor present/unknown, salvage neck dissection with tumor present/unknown > 20 weeks after the end of radiation therapy, death due to study cancer without documented progression, or death due to unknown causes without documented progression. Distant metastasis and death due to other causes are considered competing risks. Local-regional failure time is defined as time from randomization to the date of first progression/death or last known follow-up (censored). Rates are estimated by the cumulative incidence method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Distant Metastasis
secondary_outcome.description: Distant metastasis is defined as distant progression. Local-regional failure and death due to any cause are considered competing risks. Distant metastasis time is defined as time from randomization to the date of progression/death or last known follow-up (censored). Rates are estimated by the cumulative incidence method.
Overall survival time is defined as time from randomization to the date of death or last known follow-up (censored). Overall survival rates are estimated by the Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Grade 3+ Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of radiation therapy (RT) (approximately 6 weeks for Arm 1 and 5 weeks for Arm 2), then 1 month, 6 months, 1 year, and two years after end of RT
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events were graded using the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v4.0. Grade refers to the severity of the AE. The CTCAE v4.0 assigns Grades 1 through 5 with unique clinical descriptions of severity for each AE based on this general guideline: Grade 1 Mild, Grade 2 Moderate, Grade 3 Severe, Grade 4 Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5 Death related to AE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean One-year Total MD Anderson Dysphagia Inventory (MDADI) Score (Patient-reported Swallowing Outcome)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One year post-RT. Radiation therapy (RT) ends at approximately 6 weeks for Arm 1 and 5 weeks for Arm 2
secondary_outcome.description: The MDADI is a 20-item tool with each item scored as Strongly agree; Agree; No opinion; Disagree; or Strongly disagree. There is 1 global item (G1), 6 emotional subscale items (E2-E7), 5 functional subscale items (F1-F5), and 8 physical subscale items (P1-P8). For all items except E7 and F2, Strongly agree corresponds to a score of 1, Agree 2, No opinion 3, Disagree 4, and Strongly disagree 5. For E7 and F2, the scores are reversed; these 2 items are rescored to match the others before calculating summary scores. The composite (total) score is the mean of the 19 items (other than G1) X 20. Composite scores range from 20 to 100 with higher scores indicating less dysphagia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Negative Predictive Value (NPV) of Post-treatment FDG-PET/CT Scan [Fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) Positron Emission Tomography (PET)/Computed Tomography (CT)] for Progression-free Survival and Local-regional Control at Two Years
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months (scan) and two years after the end of RT (approximately 6 weeks for Arm 1 and 5 weeks for Arm 2)
secondary_outcome.description: NPV is the percentage of participants alive and failure-free at 2 years among those with a negative post-treatment scan, as evaluated by central review. Negative scan determined as follows: primary site, right neck, left neck evaluated using a 5-point ordinal scale: 1-Definite complete metabolic response (CMR), 2-Likely CMR, 3-Likely inflammatory, 4-Likely residual metabolic disease (RMD), and 5-Definite RMD. 'Negative'= 1 or 2, 'Indeterminate'=3, 'Positive' = 4 or 5. 'Negative' for all three evaluation sites = overall score of 'Negative.' Progression (failure) is defined as local, regional, or distant disease progression (PR) or any death. Local-regional progression (failure) is defined as local or regional PR, salvage surgery of the primary tumor with tumor present/unknown, salvage neck dissection with tumor present/unknown > 20 weeks post RT, death due to study cancer or unknown causes without documented PR. The protocol specified that both arms would be combined for analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Deoxyribonucleic Acid (DNA) Detection Rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to up to 2 weeks after the completion of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: With a two-sided type error rate of 5% and based on chi-squared test for proportions, there is a greater than 99% power to detect HPV DNA detection rate of 65% and 95% between the 2 groups (n=140 in each arm). The rate of detection for each group will be summarized based on binomial distributions and a 95% confidence intervals (CI) will be provided.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to up to 2 weeks after the completion of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: With a two-sided type error rate of 5% and based on paired t test for means, there is 99% power to detect HPV DNA rate decline of 0.375 (effect size) within each arm (n=140). The HPV DNA rate for each group will be summarized using means and standard deviations.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to up to 2 weeks after the completion of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between HPV DNA copy number and the nodal metabolic volume will be calculated using Spearman's correlation coefficient and R2, and the corresponding 95% CI will be provided.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to up to 2 weeks after the completion of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Univariable and multivariable cause specific analysis will be performed using the Cox proportional hazards model for rate of relapse.

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: After first step registration and prior to randomization, patients were tested for p16. Only patients with p16-positive tumors continued on to randomization. In total, 316 patients were enrolled and 308 were randomized.

group.title: IMRT 6 Weeks + Cisplatin
group.description: Cisplatin: 40 mg/m2 IV (intravenously) weekly for 6 weeks IMRT 6 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 6 weeks, 5 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

group.title: IMRT 5 Weeks
group.description: IMRT 5 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 5 weeks, 6 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

group.title: IMRT 6 Weeks + Cisplatin
group.description: Cisplatin: 40 mg/m2 IV (intravenously) weekly for 6 weeks IMRT 6 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 6 weeks, 5 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

group.title: IMRT 5 Weeks
group.description: IMRT 5 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 5 weeks, 6 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Smoking history (pack years)
measure.description: Smoking history as measured in pack-years, calculated by multiplying the number of packs of cigarettes smoked per day by the number of years the person has smoked.

measure.title: T stage, clinical
measure.description: Tumor stage per the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) 7th ed. refers to the size and/or extent of the main tumor. The higher the number after the T, the larger the tumor or the more it has grown into nearby tissues. T's may be further divided to provide more detail, such as T3a and T3b.

measure.title: N stage, clinical
measure.description: Regional lymph nodes staging per American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) 7th ed. refers to the number and/or extent of spread of lymph nodes that contain cancer. The higher the number after the N, the greater the involvement of regional lymph nodes.

measure.title: Radiation Therapy (RT) planning (as stratified)
measure.description: Radiation therapy plan included unilateral or bilateral radiation to the neck, as provided by the treating site at stratification.

measure.title: RT planning (per central review)
measure.description: Radiation therapy plan included unilateral or bilateral radiation to the neck, as provided by central review by the study radiation oncologist.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Alive Without Progression at Two Years (Progression-free Survival)
outcome.description: Progression is defined as local, regional, or distant disease progression or death due to any cause. Percentage is estimated using the binomial distribution.
outcome.population: Two-year data was available for 147/157 (Arm 1) and 145/149 (Arm 2) randomized and eligible participants.

group.title: IMRT 6 Weeks + Cisplatin (Arm 1)
group.description: Cisplatin: 40 mg/m2 IV (intravenously) weekly for 6 weeks IMRT 6 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 6 weeks, 5 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

group.title: IMRT 5 Weeks (Arm 2)
group.description: IMRT 5 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 5 weeks, 6 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Alive Without Progression at Two Years (Progression-free Survival)
measure.description: Progression is defined as local, regional, or distant disease progression or death due to any cause. Percentage is estimated using the binomial distribution.
measure.population: Two-year data was available for 147/157 (Arm 1) and 145/149 (Arm 2) randomized and eligible participants.

analysis.groups_desc: Assuming a binomial distribution, 140 eligible patients per arm were required for 80% power and 1-sided type I error rate of 10% to test the null hypothesis of 2-year progression-free survival (PFS) rate ≤ 85% against the alternative hypothesis of > 85% with a binomial test. The arms are not compared to each other; they are each tested separately against the null hypothesis.

Assuming a binomial distribution, 140 eligible patients per arm were required for 80% power and 1-sided type I error rate of 10% to test the null hypothesis of 2-year PFS rate ≤ 85% against the alternative hypothesis of > 85% with a binomial test. The arms are not compared to each other; they are each tested separately against the null hypothesis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Local-regional Failure
outcome.description: Local-regional failure is defined as local or regional progression, salvage surgery of the primary tumor with tumor present/unknown, salvage neck dissection with tumor present/unknown > 20 weeks after the end of radiation therapy, death due to study cancer without documented progression, or death due to unknown causes without documented progression. Distant metastasis and death due to other causes are considered competing risks. Local-regional failure time is defined as time from randomization to the date of first progression/death or last known follow-up (censored). Rates are estimated by the cumulative incidence method.

group.description: Cisplatin: 40 mg/m2 IV (intravenously) weekly for 6 weeks IMRT 6 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 6 weeks, 5 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

Distant metastasis and death due to other causes are considered competing risks. Local-regional failure time is defined as time from randomization to the date of first progression/death or last known follow-up (censored). Rates are estimated by the cumulative incidence method.

outcome.description: Overall survival time is defined as time from randomization to the date of death or last known follow-up (censored). Overall survival rates are estimated by the Kaplan-Meier method.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Alive
measure.description: Overall survival time is defined as time from randomization to the date of death or last known follow-up (censored). Overall survival rates are estimated by the Kaplan-Meier method.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Grade 3+ Adverse Events
outcome.description: Adverse events were graded using the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v4.0. Grade refers to the severity of the AE. The CTCAE v4.0 assigns Grades 1 through 5 with unique clinical descriptions of severity for each AE based on this general guideline: Grade 1 Mild, Grade 2 Moderate, Grade 3 Severe, Grade 4 Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5 Death related to AE.
outcome.time_frame: End of radiation therapy (RT) (approximately 6 weeks for Arm 1 and 5 weeks for Arm 2), then 1 month, 6 months, 1 year, and two years after end of RT
outcome.population: Randomized and eligible participants who started study treatment. Adverse event data was not available for all participants at each time point.

group.title: IMRT 6 Weeks + Cisplatin (Arm 1)
group.description: Cisplatin: 40 mg/m2 IV (intravenously) weekly for 6 weeks IMRT 6 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 6 weeks, 5 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

group.description: IMRT 5 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 5 weeks, 6 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

The CTCAE v4.0 assigns Grades 1 through 5 with unique clinical descriptions of severity for each AE based on this general guideline: Grade 1 Mild, Grade 2 Moderate, Grade 3 Severe, Grade 4 Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5 Death related to AE.
measure.population: Randomized and eligible participants who started study treatment. Adverse event data was not available for all participants at each time point.

analysis.groups_desc: One month after end of RT
Six months after end of RT
One year after end of RT
Two years after the end of RT

outcome.title: Mean One-year Total MD Anderson Dysphagia Inventory (MDADI) Score (Patient-reported Swallowing Outcome)
outcome.description: The MDADI is a 20-item tool with each item scored as Strongly agree; Agree; No opinion; Disagree; or Strongly disagree. There is 1 global item (G1), 6 emotional subscale items (E2-E7), 5 functional subscale items (F1-F5), and 8 physical subscale items (P1-P8). For all items except E7 and F2, Strongly agree corresponds to a score of 1, Agree 2, No opinion 3, Disagree 4, and Strongly disagree 5. For E7 and F2, the scores are reversed; these 2 items are rescored to match the others before calculating summary scores. The composite (total) score is the mean of the 19 items (other than G1) X 20. Composite scores range from 20 to 100 with higher scores indicating less dysphagia.
outcome.time_frame: One year post-RT. Radiation therapy (RT) ends at approximately 6 weeks for Arm 1 and 5 weeks for Arm 2
outcome.population: Randomized and eligible participants. Questionnaires were not completed by all participants. 121 Arm 1 and 106 Arm 2 participants had one year post-RT data.

group.title: IMRT 6 Weeks + Cisplatin (Arm 1)
group.description: Cisplatin: 40 mg/m2 IV (intravenously) weekly for 6 weeks IMRT 6 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 6 weeks, 5 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

group.title: IMRT 5 Weeks (Arm 2)
group.description: IMRT 5 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 5 weeks, 6 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

measure.title: Mean One-year Total MD Anderson Dysphagia Inventory (MDADI) Score (Patient-reported Swallowing Outcome)
measure.description: The MDADI is a 20-item tool with each item scored as Strongly agree; Agree; No opinion; Disagree; or Strongly disagree. There is 1 global item (G1), 6 emotional subscale items (E2-E7), 5 functional subscale items (F1-F5), and 8 physical subscale items (P1-P8). For all items except E7 and F2, Strongly agree corresponds to a score of 1, Agree 2, No opinion 3, Disagree 4, and Strongly disagree 5. For E7 and F2, the scores are reversed; these 2 items are rescored to match the others before calculating summary scores. The composite (total) score is the mean of the 19 items (other than G1) X 20. Composite scores range from 20 to 100 with higher scores indicating less dysphagia.
measure.population: Randomized and eligible participants. Questionnaires were not completed by all participants. 121 Arm 1 and 106 Arm 2 participants had one year post-RT data.

outcome.title: Negative Predictive Value (NPV) of Post-treatment FDG-PET/CT Scan [Fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) Positron Emission Tomography (PET)/Computed Tomography (CT)] for Progression-free Survival and Local-regional Control at Two Years
outcome.description: NPV is the percentage of participants alive and failure-free at 2 years among those with a negative post-treatment scan, as evaluated by central review. Negative scan determined as follows: primary site, right neck, left neck evaluated using a 5-point ordinal scale: 1-Definite complete metabolic response (CMR), 2-Likely CMR, 3-Likely inflammatory, 4-Likely residual metabolic disease (RMD), and 5-Definite RMD. 'Negative'= 1 or 2, 'Indeterminate'=3, 'Positive' = 4 or 5. 'Negative' for all three evaluation sites = overall score of 'Negative.' Progression (failure) is defined as local, regional, or distant disease progression (PR) or any death. Local-regional progression (failure) is defined as local or regional PR, salvage surgery of the primary tumor with tumor present/unknown, salvage neck dissection with tumor present/unknown > 20 weeks post RT, death due to study cancer or unknown causes without documented PR. The protocol specified that both arms would be combined for analysis.
outcome.time_frame: 3 months (scan) and two years after the end of RT (approximately 6 weeks for Arm 1 and 5 weeks for Arm 2)
outcome.population: Randomized and eligible participants with negative post-treatment PET

group.title: Both Arms Combined
group.description: IMRT 6 Weeks + Cisplatin arm: Cisplatin: 40 mg/m2 IV (intravenously) weekly for 6 weeks; Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 6 weeks, 5 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy. IMRT 5 weeks arm: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 5 weeks, 6 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

measure.title: Negative Predictive Value (NPV) of Post-treatment FDG-PET/CT Scan [Fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) Positron Emission Tomography (PET)/Computed Tomography (CT)] for Progression-free Survival and Local-regional Control at Two Years
measure.description: NPV is the percentage of participants alive and failure-free at 2 years among those with a negative post-treatment scan, as evaluated by central review. Negative scan determined as follows: primary site, right neck, left neck evaluated using a 5-point ordinal scale: 1-Definite complete metabolic response (CMR), 2-Likely CMR, 3-Likely inflammatory, 4-Likely residual metabolic disease (RMD), and 5-Definite RMD. 'Negative'= 1 or 2, 'Indeterminate'=3, 'Positive' = 4 or 5. 'Negative' for all three evaluation sites = overall score of 'Negative.' Progression (failure) is defined as local, regional, or distant disease progression (PR) or any death. Local-regional progression (failure) is defined as local or regional PR, salvage surgery of the primary tumor with tumor present/unknown, salvage neck dissection with tumor present/unknown > 20 weeks post RT, death due to study cancer or unknown causes without documented PR. The protocol specified that both arms would be combined for analysis.
measure.population: Randomized and eligible participants with negative post-treatment PET

analysis.groups_desc: Progression-free survival: The null hypothesis of negative predictive value ≤ 90% was tested against the alternative of > 90% with a 1-sided binomial test at the 0.10 level.
Local-regional control: The null hypothesis of negative predictive value ≤ 90% was tested against the alternative of > 90% with a 1-sided binomial test at the 0.10 level.

outcome.title: Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Deoxyribonucleic Acid (DNA) Detection Rate
outcome.description: With a two-sided type error rate of 5% and based on chi-squared test for proportions, there is a greater than 99% power to detect HPV DNA detection rate of 65% and 95% between the 2 groups (n=140 in each arm). The rate of detection for each group will be summarized based on binomial distributions and a 95% confidence intervals (CI) will be provided.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to up to 2 weeks after the completion of treatment

outcome.title: HPV DNA Rate Decline
outcome.description: With a two-sided type error rate of 5% and based on paired t test for means, there is 99% power to detect HPV DNA rate decline of 0.375 (effect size) within each arm (n=140). The HPV DNA rate for each group will be summarized using means and standard deviations.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to up to 2 weeks after the completion of treatment

outcome.title: HPV DNA Copy Number
outcome.description: Correlation between HPV DNA copy number and the nodal metabolic volume will be calculated using Spearman's correlation coefficient and R2, and the corresponding 95% CI will be provided.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to up to 2 weeks after the completion of treatment

outcome.title: Variance for HPV DNA
outcome.description: Univariable and multivariable cause specific analysis will be performed using the Cox proportional hazards model for rate of relapse.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to up to 2 weeks after the completion of treatment

reported_events.time_frame: Weekly during treatment, at 1 and 3 months after end of treatment, then every 3 months from end of treatment for 2 years, every 6 months from end of treatment for 3 years, then annually until study completion. Maximum follow-up at time of reporting was 4.1 years.

group.title: IMRT 6 Weeks + Cisplatin
group.description: Cisplatin: 40 mg/m2 IV (intravenously) weekly for 6 weeks IMRT 6 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 6 weeks, 5 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

group.title: IMRT 5 Weeks
group.description: IMRT 5 weeks: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), 30 fractions over 5 weeks, 6 fractions per week, 2 Gray per fraction to total dose of 60 Gy

event.sub_title: General disorders and administration site conditions - Other
Respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders - Other
Skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders - Other

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: PI's are required to abide by the sponsor's publication guidelines which require review by coauthors and subsequent review and approval by the sponsor.
